channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: President Trump moves to block state AI laws as New York pushes tougher rules
item.description: Alex Bores, a New York State Assembly member who sponsored an AI regulation bill, responds to President Trump's executive order aimed at blocking state oversight of artificial intelligence.
item.content:encoded: Alex Bores, a New York State Assembly member who sponsored an AI regulation bill, responds to President Trump's executive order aimed at blocking state oversight of artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: Pakistan's oldest brewery finds a path back to global markets
item.description: A Pakistani brewery founded in the 19th century is exporting beer again for the first time in decades, despite alcohol being illegal for the country's Muslim majority.
item.content:encoded: A Pakistani brewery founded in the 19th century is exporting beer again for the first time in decades, despite alcohol being illegal for the country's Muslim majority.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: The new 'Knives Out' movie and the irresistible appeal of whodunits
item.description: NPR's Linda Holmes and Barrie Hardymon talk about why whodunits feel so cozy, what makes a great mystery work, and why the genre is having a moment again on screen.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Linda Holmes and Barrie Hardymon talk about why whodunits feel so cozy, what makes a great mystery work, and why the genre is having a moment again on screen.
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes

item.title: A podcast investigates alleged sexual abuse in one of Louisville's schools
item.description: Jess Clark, host of Louisville Public Media's podcast 'Dig', examines how alleged abuse by school staff went unaddressed for nearly 18 years in Louisville.
item.content:encoded: Jess Clark, host of Louisville Public Media's podcast 'Dig', examines how alleged abuse by school staff went unaddressed for nearly 18 years in Louisville.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Nate Amos finds new meaning in old material on 'Holo Boy'
item.description: Nate Amos, the songwriter behind This Is Lorelei, talks about revisiting old songs, reshaping them, and what it means to hear his past work with new ears.
item.content:encoded: Nate Amos, the songwriter behind This Is Lorelei, talks about revisiting old songs, reshaping them, and what it means to hear his past work with new ears.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Ukraine's ceasefire talks hinge on security promises Russia once broke
item.description: Ukraine's president continues ceasefire talks in Berlin with Trump envoys and European leaders, pressing for concrete security guarantees so Russia won't invade Ukraine again in the future.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's president continues ceasefire talks in Berlin with Trump envoys and European leaders, pressing for concrete security guarantees so Russia won't invade Ukraine again in the future.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Australia reels from mass shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach
item.description: Phil Mercer, a journalist in Sydney, reports on the deadly shooting at a Hanukkah event at Bondi Beach and what authorities are saying about the attack.
item.content:encoded: Phil Mercer, a journalist in Sydney, reports on the deadly shooting at a Hanukkah event at Bondi Beach and what authorities are saying about the attack.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: What we know so far about the Brown University shooting investigation
item.description: Journalist Paul C. Kelly Campos of Ocean State Media on the continuing investigation into Saturday's shooting at Brown University that left two people dead and at least nine more wounded.
item.content:encoded: Journalist Paul C. Kelly Campos of Ocean State Media on the continuing investigation into Saturday's shooting at Brown University that left two people dead and at least nine more wounded.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Shooting at Brown University kills two, others injured, says Mayor of Providence
item.description: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence, Rhode Island says two people are dead and multiple people hurt after a shooting at Brown University.
item.content:encoded: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence, Rhode Island says two people are dead and multiple people hurt after a shooting at Brown University.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Former Republican congressman on why it's so hard to get bipartisan consensus on healthcare
item.description: Fred Upton, a former Republican congressman from Michigan, discusses the Senate's failed health care votes and the political fallout of rising insurance premiums.
item.content:encoded: Fred Upton, a former Republican congressman from Michigan, discusses the Senate's failed health care votes and the political fallout of rising insurance premiums.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley
